text:
Baadur Tsuladze (5 March, 1935 – 13 May 2018) was a Georgian actor, movie director, screenwriter and broadcaster. He was an Honored Artist of the Georgian SSR (1979).
In acting, Tsuladze was known for his role as Archill in "Falling Leaves" (1966). In directing, he was known for his 1975 movie "Waltz on Mtatsminda" and wrote the screenplay for "For those who like to solve puzzles" (1982).
Tsuladze died on 13 May 2018 in Tbilisi at the age of 83.

annotations.surface_form: For those who like to solve puzzles
